DOCNAME: CASE OF EVAGOROU CHRISTOU v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property;Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant lived with her family in GPE , a village in LOC . During the DATE intervention , the NORP military troops evicted the applicant and her family from their home and forced them to leave PERSON and flee to the south .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that until DATE , when the properties were transferred to her children , she had been the owner of CARDINAL plots of land in GPE , CARDINAL of which had CARDINAL house each on them . CARDINAL of these houses had been the applicant ’s home . It was an ancestral house built in DATE , comprising huge , spacious rooms , CARDINAL bedrooms , a living room , a kitchen and a bathroom . It had CARDINAL levels and a huge yard . It was built of stone , had marble floors and a titled roof , and wooden doors and windows . The second house was the applicant ’s holiday home , built in DATE and situated in the locality known as GPE . It had CARDINAL spacious bedrooms and was very close to the sea ( QUANTITY ) .

CARDINAL . In support to her claim to ownership , the applicant produced affirmations of ownership issued by ORG , stating that she was the legal and registered owner of the QUANTITY houses and of the pieces of lands registered under the plots nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL .
The applicant also produced certificates of registration for CARDINAL of the CARDINAL properties at issue .
CARDINAL . The applicant claimed that she had been prevented from returning to her home and properties because the NORP military authorities had continuously occupied and used them .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant made an attempt to return to her home and property in GPE and in GPE by participating in a convoy of cars of fellow refugees intending to return home . The demonstration organisers had informed the Commander of ORG ( ORG ) forces in GPE of their intentions .

CARDINAL . The applicant and her fellow refugees stopped at the check point in the " buffer zone " , on the main road linking GPE and GPE . There , they asked the ORG officer on duty to be allowed to return to their homes , property and villages . They requested the same officer to forward their demand to the NORP military authorities . The officer replied that the latter had refused their request .
